data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD clings to gains above $1,860, focus remains on US CPI report
data.text: Gold price attracts some buying on Tuesday and recovers a major part of the previous day's slide to the $1,850 level, or its lowest level since January 6. The XAU/USD sticks to modest intraday gains through the first half of the European session and is currently trading just above the $1,860 level, up nearly 0.50% for the day.

data.title: Investors Are Anticipating the CPI Report and Its Potential Impact on Gold Prices.
data.text: Investors are eagerly awaiting the January CPI inflation report, set to be released by the BLS in under 24 hours on February 14 at 8:30 EST. This report will shed light on the US CPI data for the previous month.

data.title: Gold Futures: Extra decline not ruled out
data.text: Open interest in gold futures markets rose by just 375 contracts for the first time since February 2 on Monday, according to preliminary readings from CME Group. Volume, instead, shrank for the second consecutive session, this time by nearly 25K contracts.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD to sink toward $1,825 on hotter-than-expected US CPI
data.text: Gold price rebounds from week lows at $1,850. But XAU/USD could resume drop toward $1,825 on hot US Consumer Price Index, FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta reports.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD approaches $1,860 after a recovery move, spotlight is on US Inflation
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) is marginally far from reclaiming the critical resistance of $1,860.00 in the Tokyo session. The precious metal recovered firmly after sensing buying interest around $1,850.00 as the US Dollar Index (DXY) surrendered the immediate support of 102.80.

data.title: Gold Prices Turn to US CPI Report, Will Softer Inflation Rekindle XAU/USD?
data.text: Gold prices extended losses on Monday heading into a hotly anticipated US CPI report. Will a softer inflation surprise reverse the yellow metal's recent misfortune?

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD sitting tight over the abyss ahead of US CPI
data.text: Gold decoupled from the US Dollar's trajectory on Monday, sinking at the same time as the greenback as investors get set for this week's key event in the US Consumer Price Index. However, if the CPI data were to be a dovish outcome, then the Gold price stands to benefit and should the bears be in the market heading into the data, a short squeeze could eventuate as illustrated below.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: Death cross favors XAU/USD bears ahead of United States inflation
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) holds lower ground at the monthly bottom surrounding $1,855, following the slump to early January levels the previous day, as markets brace for the United States Consumer Price Index (CPI) for January. Also pausing the XAU/USD's declines is the US Dollar pullback, as well as the firmer sentiment.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bears comply with symmetrical triangle
data.text: Gold price was choppy in New York but decisively bearish as per the technicals and failures to rally even on US Dollar weakness as the session got going around the London fix and Wall Street's cash open.  Gold price is currently trading at $1,850 and at the bottom of a new box that was formed in Friday's sell-off.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD stumbles to 5-week lows at around $1850 amid falling US bond yields
data.text: Gold price retreated from last Friday's highs of $1872.22 and dropped toward the $1850 area on Monday despite the US Dollar (USD) fall, ahead of a vital inflation report from the United States (US). Additionally, US Treasury yields, albeit edging down, remain at around five-week highs.

data.title: Gold, Silver, Platinum – Gold Retreats As Demand For Safe-Haven Assets Declines
data.text: Demand for precious metals declines as traders focus on the strong rebound in U.S. stock markets.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast – Gold Markets Dropped to the 50-Day EMA
data.text: Gold markets have fallen a bit during the trading session on Monday, as we have reached the 50-Day EMA again.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD could dive below $1,800 on more technical sell-offs – ANZ
data.text: Gold's bullish momentum has been fading. A further sell-off could confirm prices falling below $1,800 in the short-term, strategists at ANZ bank report.

data.title: Gold Prices Look Oversold but the Short-Term Outlook Remains Uncertain
data.text: The precious metal remains under downside pressure, despite flashing an oversold technical signal, as the latest look at US price pressures near.

data.title: Should you buy or sell gold after correcting $100 from February highs?
data.text: The gold price has rallied since last October in line with the dollar's weakness. The dollar index (DXY), which tracks the dollar's weakness or strength against a basket of currencies, completed the largest three-month drop in January since 2009.

data.title: Technical Analysis – Gold's bullish channel at risk; support at 50-SMA
data.text: Gold was experiencing a flat trading session around the 1,860 level during Monday's early European hours after a not-so-encouraging week, which sent the price to a one-month low of 1,852.

data.title: Orbex: Gold Takes Another Dive!
data.text: Gold and Silver have had trading sessions to forget as both metals fell. Gold was looking to reclaim the $1900 level before another sell-off hit the yellow metal.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast XAU/USD – Traders Bracing for Higher Headline, Core US Consumer Inflation
data.text: Cautious gold traders are squaring positions ahead of Tuesday's U.S. CPI report that could influence the Fed's future interest rate decisions.

data.title: Gold Price Started a Fresh Decline from $1,890
data.text: Gold price started a fresh decline from the $1,890 zone against the US Dollar. The price declined steadily below $1,880 and moved into a bearish zone.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD manages to defend 50 DMA, upside remains capped
data.text: Gold price extends its consolidative price move through the early European session on Monday and is currently placed around the $1,865 region. The XAU/USD manages to hold above the 50-day Simple Moving Average (SMA) support, though remains well within the striking distance of over a one-month low touched on Friday.
